seniority_level.evidence: Title "Data Architect & Leader" and responsibility for leading a team indicate a senior‑level position.

job_family.evidence: Job title and core responsibilities focus on architectural design, data modeling, and integration within a Microsoft environment.

sub_specialty.evidence: Mentions using MS Fabric for ETL and building advanced reporting; Fabric supports lakehouse architectures.

leadership_expectation.evidence: Described as a "player‑coach" role leading a small team (Data Engineer and Data Scientist) with hands‑on technical work.

primary_cloud.evidence: Must have experience in a "Microsoft environment" and use of MS Fabric, which are Azure services.

secondary_clouds.evidence: No other cloud providers are mentioned in the posting.

processing_paradigm.evidence: Focus on ETL processes and reporting; no streaming or real‑time technologies are referenced.

orchestrator_category.evidence: The posting does not name any workflow/orchestration tool such as Airflow, Dagster, etc.

storage_layer.evidence: Architectural design across a large Microsoft environment with thousands of tables and stored procedures suggests a relational data warehouse approach.

remote_restriction.evidence: Location restriction text: "Remote, anywhere in the US" (US‑only).

timezone_focus.evidence: Remote work limited to the United States implies a focus on American time zones.

relocation_required.evidence: The role is fully remote within the US; no relocation language is present.

h1b_friendly.evidence: Visa sponsorship is not mentioned; default assumption is no sponsorship.

opt_cpt_friendly.evidence: No reference to OPT/CPT or student visas; work authorization is implied for standard employees.

citizenship_required.evidence: Remote US‑only role; only work authorization in the US is required, no citizenship restriction stated.

w2_vs_1099.evidence: Job type is Full‑Time, Exempt, and described as a permanent position, indicating a W‑2 employee.

benefits_level.evidence: Benefits listed: medical, dental, vision, 401(k), PTO – typical standard package.

growth_path_clarity.evidence: The posting mentions leadership and a player‑coach role but does not spell out explicit career ladders.

mentorship_signals.evidence: Leading and mentoring a small team suggests informal mentorship, though no formal program is described.

promotion_path_mentioned.evidence: No language about promotion, advancement, or career ladders appears in the posting.

internal_mobility_mentioned.evidence: The posting does not reference internal transfers or mobility opportunities.

career_tracks_available.evidence: Role blends deep technical responsibilities (architect) with people‑leadership (team lead), implying both IC and management tracks.

requirement_strictness.evidence: A clear list of required hard and soft skills with no explicit "nice‑to‑have" items; balanced but not overly restrictive.

scope_definition.evidence: Job description focuses specifically on data architecture, integration, and leading a small team – a well‑defined scope.

skill_inflation_detected.evidence: Required skill set aligns with a senior‑level data architect role; no unrealistic junior‑level expectations are present.
